results.title: Adventures in perception
results.creator_credit: Han Van Gelder and Han Van Gelder Filmproducktie N V
results.brief_description: Depicts the art works of Dutch artist Murits Escher, who creates illusions of shape by the use in his painting, drawing, sculpture etc. of such devices of mirror imagery, repetition, metamorphosis and geometric design.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Han Van Gelder and Han Van Gelder Filmproducktie N V

results.title: Adventures at day camp
results.creator_credit: Walter S Stern, Carol Hale and Girl Scouts of the USA
results.brief_description: Illustrates the value of a summer day camp for girls, showing the planning by the camp committees for shelters, equipment, transportation, leadership, outdoor and indoor camping activities. Describes how girls are able to put into practice some of the skills they learned in their troops - weaving grass mats, cooking out of doors and building bird-feeding houses, etc.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walter S Stern, Carol Hale and Girl Scouts of the USA

results.title: Adventures
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of a little raccoon who encounters many adventures when he strays from home to explore the world around him. The raccoon and all the other creatures in the film are real but are given voices by a little girl and her father. The situations are all natural and amusing. Suitable for very young children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubbo, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Adventure playgrounds
results.creator_credit: Stanley Schofield and National Playing Fields Association
results.brief_description: An adventure playground can be created by children themselves, out of scrap materials on a piece of wasteland. It can provide an outlet for energy, a means for building self-confidence, and reducing the juvenile delinquency rate. Discusses the importance of the play leader.

results.title: Adventure on
results.creator_credit: Tom Stobart, Geoffrey Sumner, Film Producers Guild and British Information Services
results.brief_description: A world report from a vineyard in france to indigenous agricultural farming in the Himalayas on farm mechanisation visiting five continents and 27 countries.

results.title: Adventure in Venice
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents aspects of day-to-day life in Venice. Tells a story about a boy who loses a prized model ship on the waterways of his city. Gives a comprehensive view of this water dependent city, noting the historic sites and large tourist trade.
results.description: Presents aspects of day-to-day life in Venice. Tells a story about a boy who loses a prized model ship on the waterways of his city. Gives a comprehensive view of this water dependent city, noting the historic sites and large tourist trade.

results.title: Adventure in Newfoundland
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A boy’s adventure on Green Island, New Foundland. Gulls, puffins, murres, kittiwakes and other winged fishers occupy every inch of space where young Tom accompanies a bird-banding expedition. When a rope slips and a bad fall threatens, Tom makes a quick, sure-footed recovery.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Adventure in maturity
results.creator_credit: University of Oklahoma and Oklahoma. State Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A middle-aged woman living with her son constantly thinks of the ‘old days’. Through the intervention of an old friend, her interest in life is re-awakened as she visits a beauty parlour and rejuvenates her appearance, takes a job in the community and is once more busy and active.

results.title: Adventure has wings
results.creator_credit: Anthony Clay and Royal Society for the Protection of Birds
results.brief_description: Shows the variety of birds in Britain in different situations as seen by two town children, two country children, and their friends. How the RSPB’s Young Ornithologist’s Club makes birdwatching more enjoyable more adventurous. Designed for showing to children aged 9-13 years to increase their interest in birds and birdwatching.

results.title: Advances in cheddar cheesemaking
results.brief_description: Designed primarily for the cheese industry. Firstly it shows the traditional method of cheesemaking and then it describes a mechanical process developed to reduce the time and labour required.
